poem:
Seven Sisters Road  

Three girls, a shadowed tale unfolds,  
under stammering streetlights' flicker,  
shadows entwine where time grows cold.  
His years scattered like autumn leaves,  
a Bolivian heart stilled by night air,  
old stories silenced by young hands.  
In the concrete echoes, remorse and ghosts  
linger on Seven Sisters' silent path.
